abstract: Political Memo; amounts raised by presidential candidates for the 2012 elections are not as reliable as an indicator of who is winning the fund-raising race due to the rise of 'super PACs,'; groups were unleashed by court rulings that struck down limits on contributions to outside groups as long as they do not directly coordinate their expenditures with candidates.
snippet: Third-quarter filings disclosed fund-raising by Republican candidates, but the heft of their Super PACs, which can play a huge role in the campaign, is still not known.
lead_paragraph: Third-quarter filings disclosed fund-raising by Republican candidates, but the heft of their Super PACs, which can play a huge role in the campaign, is still not known.

headline.main: Without ‘Super PAC’ Numbers, Campaign Filings Present an Incomplete Picture
headline.print_headline: Without ‘Super PAC’ Numbers, Campaign Filings Present an Incomplete Picture
headline.seo: Campaign Finance Filings Present an Incomplete Picture
